result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim M. Bartley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Dunn County Probation.
Court reads-in and dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to St. Croix County Probation today January 9, 2015.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Charles S. Huff   DF:  Kim M. Bartley appeared. Set for plea. Case called at 10:05 a.m. ADA Correll informs Court of agreement.  DE pleads guilty to Ct 1. DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt notes DE's acknowledgment of Ct 2. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State, Crt reads in for purposes of restitution and dismisses Ct 2. Court waives PSI at this time. Recommendations by Attorneys. DE makes statement. 
Crt orders:  S/W, 2 years probation concurrent w/Dunn County Probation, with conditions.

Conditions of probation are:

-45 days conditions time - stayed.
-Restitution to Fleet Farm of $4455.08. Restitution to Menards to be determined.
-Court costs and supervision costs payable through probation.
-Court waives DNA sample.
-30 hours community service.
-DE to maintain current mental healthcare treatment.
-Any other programming that Agent deems necessary

Crt allows restitution amounts to be confirmed within 30 days. DE to report to St. Croix County probation today.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Charles S Huff   DF:  Kim M. Bartley appeared. Information filed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  DE pleads not guilty. Speedy waived. Discovery due within 20 business days. Motions due within 10 business days upon receipt of Discovery. Face to face settlement conference. Adjourned at 3:13 p.m.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Charles S Huff   DF:  Kim M. Bartley appeared. Set for preliminary. Case called at 3:07 p.m. Court questions DE. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds DE over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Filed by Atty Huff. km
Filed by Atty Huff. km
Per TCH 5/2/14 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Preliminary hearing on June 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Menards or Fleet Farm in St. Croix County.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: TCH for SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill,   ADA:  Alexis S Mckinley & Annalise Backstrom,   DF ATTY: Joshua Hargrove for today only,  DF:  Kim M. Bartley did not appear.  Def is in custody.    QUASH WARRANT.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
